comments:
After upgrading to Mylar 0.9 I cannot connect to Bugzilla repositories, one at work, the other bugs.eclipse.org.
Get following error:

-- Error Log --
Date: Sun Nov 12 10:31:26 MST 2006
Message: Error updating attributes.

null

Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar.core
Stack Trace:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Error updating attributes.

null
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaCorePlugin.getRepositoryConfiguration(BugzillaCorePlugin.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.updateAttributes(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:276)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.views.ResetRepositoryConfigurationAction$1.run(ResetRepositoryConfigurationAction.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[1]: org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaException

	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.connectInternal(BugzillaClient.java:148)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

--- Cause was:
java.net.ConnectException: connect: Address is invalid on local machine, or port is not valid on remote machine
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source)

	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.authenticate(BugzillaClient.java:247)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.connectInternal(BugzillaClient.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.getConnect(BugzillaClient.java:137)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaClient.getRepositoryConfiguration(BugzillaClient.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaCorePlugin.getRepositoryConfiguration(BugzillaCorePlugin.java:125)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.bugzilla.core.BugzillaRepositoryConnector.updateAttributes(BugzillaRepositoryConnector.java:276)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.views.ResetRepositoryConfigurationAction$1.run(ResetRepositoryConfigurationAction.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

This comment is made from Eclipse Bug connector on another machine, which runs Mylar 0.8 and Java 1.5_07. The desktop machine which causes the failure is running Mylar 0.9 and Java 1.5_09 (latest, on Mik's recommendation related to another bug).

I also tried Eclipse 3.3M3 with Mylar 0.9 (that is what I use to type) running in JDK 1.5_07 (on my laptop) and all repositories including new web connector are working.
So next step is on my desktop to use 1.5_07 instead of 1.5_09 and try running Eclipse 3.2/Mylar 0.9.

I downgraded my desktop to JDK 1.5_07, removed .mylar and removed mylar from plugins, features dirs. Then installed Mylar 0.9 and I have the same problem with Eclipse 3.2. So I removed .mylar and removed mylar from plugins, features dirs and installed Mylar 0.8 from archive update site, restarted Eclipse, created repositories and Queries and everything works.
Note, I wasn't brave enough to upgrade my laptop's Eclipse 3.2 with Mylar 0.9 (Mylar 0.9 works). I only tried and made work Eclipse 3.3M3 with Mylar 0.9.
So it might be, that this problem is more global than I thought. It might be problem with Eclipse 3.2 and Mylar 0.9.

Looking at the stack trace, seems like a network problem.

Are there another stack trace before this with the same timestamp?

Can you test on a clean installation?

Yes it seems so. But the all other networking works OK, and I can go to those sites with browser. And after un-installing 0.9 and reinstalling 0.8 (without reboot) everything seems to work. I also know that Eclipse 3.3M3 works with 0.9. I think the problem is with Eclipse 3.2 only. I even uninstalled JDK 1.5_09 and reinstalled JDK 1.5_07 (see above), because I thought the networking problems might be caused by JDK 1.5_09 upgrade (see above). I am running out of ideas. Lets see if anybody else has similar problems.

I have just installed Eclipse 3.3M3 with Mylar 0.9 on the same machine, where I have problems with Eclipse 3.2 with Mylar 0.9 and Bugzilla connectors work with Eclipse 3.3M3 unlike with Eclipse 3.2 with Mylar 0.9.

I can't believe the JDK version can be any source of problems.

I just updated my Eclipse 3.2 installation with Mylar 0.9.0 in my work machine and it is working fine.

I'm also running it on JRE 6 RC b104.

I had some troubles with proxy configuration. Are your repositories on internal network, or on internet?

I am trying Eclipse.org, so it is internet account. It is good to hear that it works for you, it might be some other plugin which messes me up.
I can live with Eclipse 3.3M3 8-).

OK, while doing migration to Eclipse 3.3M3, I found that I have a same problem if I use the workspace I used with Eclipse 3.2. So my problem with Mylar 0.9 connectors is definitely workspace related. Note, that I did removed workspace/.metadata/.plugin/*mylar*, so it si probably something else, but I do not have an idea what.

I may have experienced a problem similar to the one described in this bug report. If not, please ignore my comment. 

I just downloaded Eclipse 3.2 and Mylar 0.9 (via Update Manager). I have set up Bugzilla 2.22.1 on localhost. My internet connection (for updates etc.) is via proxy. My Bugzilla installation works perfectly in the browser. 

Everytime I want to connect with Bugzilla in Mylar I get this error in .log (see below for a possible solution):

I found out that Mylar tries to connect to localhost via my internet proxy. I disabled the proxy in Preferences->Internet but it did not help. After also disabling the proxy in Preferences->Install/Update it did work. To me it seems that Mylar uses the wrong proxy settings (for Install/Update instead of Internet) and also ignores the Non proxy hostnames. Perhaps this information does help you finding the problem...

There is some proxy configuration conflicts when you have platform + Callisto installed.

This is not a Mylar problem. Please see bug#154100.

Yes, Mylar uses the proxy settings from Install/Update, as documented here, and as Willian points out we have no other Eclipse-configured proxy settings that we can use, and have avoided adding our own.  This is documented at:

http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Network_and_proxy_server_troubleshooting

But more and more people are running into this problem and it is a constant source of confusion, and Eclipse 3.3 is still a long ways off for the majority of our user community.  Do others have suggestions?  Should we consider adding proxy settings to each repository's configuration page? i.e. on http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/images/0.9.0/bugzilla-auth.gif

I do not believe my problem is related to proxy settings. If I switch to new workspace everything work. I just abondoned my original workspace used with Mylar 0.8 and created new one for Mylar 0.9 and I had to migrate all my projects to it (painful).
I will try on my laptop to migrate to Mylar 0.9 using original workspace, but I will try to delete .metadata/.plugins dir.

(In reply to comment #12)
>  Should we consider adding
> proxy settings to each repository's configuration page? i.e. on
> http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/images/0.9.0/bugzilla-auth.gif
> 

Oh no! More proxy preference pages! :)

What I do in my case is to enable proxy every time I run Install/Update and disable it after that.

Strange is that I cannot reach eclipse.org update servers without the proxy configuration, but I can synchronize with eclipse.org bugzilla with it off.

Do you know how Eclipse deal with proxy configurations? i.e., how it deals with VM settings (it overrides?).

And what classes Mylar uses to access bugzilla? HttpConnection? jakarta-http-client?

Perhaps with this information we can reach a solution.

I upgraded my laptop Eclipse 3.2 to Mylar 0.9 and got the same problems as with desktop, none of the bugzilla connectors was able to connect. During restart after upgrade I got stacktrace error below.
So I removed workspace/.metadata/.plugins and restarted Eclipse and bugzilla connectors work again (I am using it right now). It is somewhat painful, because you lose all your setting, but better than losing the whole workspace. Note, I tried to just remove *mylar* from .metadata/.plugins, but that did not help.

Lubos, I think it is better to try to isolate the problem.

Can you try a clean Eclipse 3.2 + Mylar 0.9.0 installation (only there plugins, no Callisto, no third party plugins), in a new clear workspace, with a new tasklist?

Then, try to create a bugzilla repository from scratch?

This way we can be sure if there is no problem with your workspace and/or your context repository.

I know this works. Now I know narrower scope in .metadata/.plugins I removed org.eclipse.core.runtime and org.eclipse.core.resources and restarted. Bugzilla connector works!
Then I added org.eclipse.core.resources/.projects and .root and .safetable (no history), and Bugzilla connector works!
Then I added to org.eclipse.core.runtime/.settings only the preferences from plugins I know and use, no or.eclipse stuff, and Bugzilla connector works!

BTW, here is the stacktrace I mentioned in the previous comment (and forgot to add):

Lubos: as Willian indicates we have no way of identifying the problem with the information provided, and can not reproduce it.  That stack trace is a problem with JDT or your Eclipse configuration, not with Mylar, which only shows up in the stack because it is trying to open up a Java editor.  It is really easy to get Eclipse into a confused mode moving around .metadata and .settings, and given that stack trace I worry that this is the case for what happened to you.  

If you can provide reproducible steps with a fresh workspace for this bug please reopen so that we can try again to reproduce.

Mik, makes sense. Believe me I spent about 10 hours chasing it down, but I couldn't pin it down closer than I did. I hope I am the only one who has problems like that. But if not at least this bug might give a clues how to fix the problem.
It did happened to me on two machines, desktop and laptop, but I have similar set of plugins and projects on both, so that is expected.
Thanks for posting your experiences Lubos, and keep us posted if you see any more clues.

traces.message: connect: Address is invalid on local machine, or port is not valid on remote machine
